title: When Naming a New Product, Make it Easy to Pronounce. But Not Always.
sub_head: Researchers also found that the same rules applied when naming a dog. Itâ€™s all about control.
body:
Coming up with a new name for a product? Then it may be wise to consider this recent research finding: Consumers felt they had more control over products whose names were easier to pronounce.
In one study, researchers gave participants the exact same golf ball with four different made-up brand names: Machakw, Weayaya, Chatima and Melvern. Participants used the balls on a putting green, and then were asked to rate each ball on a seven-point scale, with 1 being difficult to control and 7 being easy to control.
